summary: Financial institutions must file currency transaction reports for any cash transactions in amounts greater than $10,000 a day. Law enforcement agencies can use the reports to investigate drug trafficking, terrorist acts, fraud, and other criminal activities. The number of reports filed has increased by about 62% since FY 2002. The reporting threshold hasn't been updated for inflation since it was set in the 1970s—which may...
title: Currency Transaction Reports: Improvements Could Reduce Filer Burden While Still Providing Useful Information to Law Enforcement
